member.name: P:EPiServer.Personalization.Commerce.CatalogFeed.CatalogFeedSettings.AssetGroupName
member.summary: Gets or sets the asset group name that the first asset in the group will be used when creating the imageLink element.
member.remarks: If it is set to null or empty, then the first asset will be used, regardless of group.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Personalization.Commerce.CatalogFeed.CatalogFeedSettings.ShouldSkipProductLevel(System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if variants should be exported as individual items or as sub elements of their parent products.
member.remarks: If false; variants that have parent products will be exported as variants of their parents. If true; product entries will be ignored and all variants will be exported as individual items. Default value is false.

member.summary: Gets the name of the catalog to create the product feed from.

member.remarks: If this is not set, the first catalog will be used.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Personalization.Commerce.CatalogFeed.DefaultFeedUrlConverter.GetExternalUrl(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a relative path to an absolute URL, by interpreting the scope as a site definition ID (Guid) and using the URL of the resolved site definition. Falls back to the default site definition (wildcard host) if the scope does not resolve to a specific site.

The site scope that the catalog feed is created for.
member.returns: A external absolute representation of , i.e. the URL that would be used by a site visitor or other external party to access the resource.

member.summary: Get the available inventory quantity for a product, to include in the catalog feed and use as input to the algorithms for product recommendations. This may be the sum, max, min or other value based on the provided product variations and inventory available across warehouses.
member.param: The site scope that the catalog feed is created for.
member.returns: The available quantity.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Personalization.Commerce.CatalogFeed.IEntryInventoryService.GetInventory(EPiServer.Commerce.Catalog.ContentTypes.EntryContentBase,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the inventory quantity for a specific entry, to include in the catalog feed and use as input to the algorithms for product recommendations. This method gets the inventory the individual variations of a product, but also to get the inventory for packages. This may be the sum, max, min or other value based on the inventory available across warehouses.
member.param: The entry to get the inventory quantity for.
The site scope that the catalog feed is created for.
member.returns: The available quantity.
